channel.title: Homes on Eldar Insafutdinov
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Eldar Insafutdinov

item.description: I am a 3rd year PhD student at the Computer Vision group in Max Planck Institute for Informatics under the supervision of Prof. Bernt Schiele. I am insterested in applying Deep Learning to challenging Computer Vision problems. More specifically, I have been working on human pose estimation in unconstrained scenes and unsupervised learning of 3D representations. I obtained my master’s degree in Visual Computing from the Saarland University. Contact | Google Scholar | GitHub | LinkedIn

item.title: Other
item.description: DeepLabCut Above: courtesy of the Murthy (mouse), Leventhal (rat), and Axel (fly) labs. My keypoint detection algorithm from the DeeperCut paper served as the foundation for DeepLabCut, a framework for studying the behavior of animals in the lab setting developed by neuroscientists at the Universities of TÃ¼bingen and Harvard. The framework gained significant popularity and is now used in more than 50 labs for a variety of tracking tasks. The framework is discussed in the corresponding Nature Neuroscience paper and was covered in the Nature and The Atlantic.
